cwe_description: The product writes data past the end of an intended buffer. This can corrupt data, crash the program, or in some circumstances, allow for arbitrary code execution.
explanation: The code contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability. Inside the inner loop, which iterates with index 'j' from 0 to t->args_size() - 1, the expression 't->mutable_args(i)' incorrectly uses the outer loop's index 'i' instead of the inner loop's index 'j'. If 'i' is greater than or equal to 't->args_size()', this will result in an out-of-bounds access, leading to undefined behavior, memory corruption, or a crash.

cwe_description: The product writes data past the end of an intended buffer.
explanation: The inner loop iterates using index 'j' but incorrectly uses the outer loop's index 'i' when calling 't->mutable_args(i)'. This can lead to an out-of-bounds write if the value of 'i' (from the outer loop) is greater than or equal to 't->args_size()', resulting in memory corruption.
